org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.bluetooth

Class SimpleBluetoothLeAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.bluetooth.SimpleBluetoothLeAdapter

  • public class SimpleBluetoothLeAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple Bluetooth Low Energy adapter. This class simplifies the operations of scan and check of connected devices.
    Author:
    Riccardo Mancini
    See Also:
    https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/connectivity/bluetooth-le#java

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SimpleBluetoothLeAdapter.OnScanStartStopListener
      Interface for receiving callbacks when the scan is started and stopped.

    • Method Detail

      • checkBluetooth

        public boolean checkBluetooth()
        Checks whether bluetooth is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if the bluetooth is enabled, false otherwise.

      • scanLeDevice

        private void scanLeDevice(boolean enable)
        Starts/stops a Bluetooth Low Energy scan. The scan will be automatically stopped after scanPeriod milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        enable - true to start a scan, false to stop it.
        See Also:
        setScanPeriod(int)

      • startScan

        public void startScan()
        Starts a Bluetooth Low Energy scan. The scan will be automatically stopped after scanPeriod milliseconds.
        See Also:
        setScanPeriod(int)

      • stopScan

        public void stopScan()
        Stops a Bluetooth Low Energy scan.

      • setScanPeriod

        public void setScanPeriod(int scanPeriod)
        Sets the duration of the scan in milliseconds.

      • setLeScanCallback

        public void setLeScanCallback(android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback leScanCallback)
        Sets the callback to be called when new devices are found.

      • setOnScanStartStopListener

        public void setOnScanStartStopListener(SimpleBluetoothLeAdapter.OnScanStartStopListener listener)
        Sets the callback to be called when the scan is started and stopped.

      • getScanPeriod

        public int getScanPeriod()
        Returns the duration of the scan in milliseconds.

      • isDeviceConnected

        public boolean isDeviceConnected(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device)
        Checks whether the given device is connected.
        Parameters:
        device - the device
        Returns:
        true if the device is connected, false otherwise.

      • isScanning

        public boolean isScanning()
        Checks whether a scan is currently in progress.
        Returns:
        true if a scan is running, false otherwise.
